review: Starting taking Vitamin d at 50,000 weekly. My levels were 20 ng/ml. Felt extremely unwell, and feeling of sickness right away. Dry mouth. It was time for my second dose a week later, loss of appetite, severe GERD, extreme upper left abdomen pain, end up in the ER. But I didn’t put the two and two together until now, this all came all of sudden when I started taking this prescribe vitamin d. I’m going to stop taking it and hope this feeling all goes away soon. I want to stop feeling like I’m going to die.

I began taking this supplement 4 years ago when I was told my levels were too low. I began having hypothyroid symptoms within months. Hair loss, dry hair and skin, achy joints, migraines. But my levels were all normal. On a whim, I recently stopped taking the vitamin d and my symptoms have all disappeared! Every doctor I saw kept saying it wasn't the supplement. I am so frustrated that there is relatively no information about it causing more issues in some people such as myself.

Vitamin D3 (cholecalciferol):1st day fine on Vitamin D3, 2nd day horrible, day 3 no better side effects shakiness, skipped heartbeats and tired. I've tried this several times in the past few months. All with same side effects. I'm only taking 1000 IU'S.  No more taking this as of today.

Vitamin D3 (cholecalciferol):I was told by Dr to take 1000iu of Vit d I also take verapmil and after 1 week I had heart skips/ weakness/shakey/and could not walk straight could not find out what was wrong till I checked this site and found other people had these problems I stopped Vit D today and hope I feel better soon
